CSE 570 Wireless/Mobile Networking (Fall 2014)

  • Grading: occasional quizzes and homeworks (33%), midterm and final exam (33%), term project – in groups of 2, for more involved work 3 is acceptable, solo project is also acceptable, but not ideal (34%). If significant work is done in project – specifically developing a useful tool or analysis, there could be more weight on project.
  • Slides used in 1st lecture (9/3) on wireless physical layerExternal Link
  • Text used for wireless physical layer: COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS ENGINEERING, Proakis and Salehi, Prentice Hall, 2002 Ed. (see sec 7.6 for bit error rate analysis for binary PAM etc.)
  • Nitin Vaidya's notes. See Chapter 2 for wireless physical layer. External Link
  • Lecture on (9/8): time domain and freq. domain representation, basic concepts of Fourier Series and Transforms, Shannon's capacity law, concept of dB, dBm. Difference between capacity, bit rate, throughput, bandwidth. Read Vaidya's notes - Chapter 2.
  • Lecture on (9/9): BER vs. SINR for 802.11. Friis path loss equation. Path loss calculator. Also, Read Vaidya's notes - Chapter 2, everything regarding path loss. Survey paper on wireless path loss and coverage prediction. Read at least Sec IIIA, Sec IVC and skim through the rest.
